commits.message:
SkQP: fix broken JUnit tests & report output

Switches over to writing output to the sd card.

Change-Id: Ic287a741b9af471f823a7e97eb0c6d3d20f639d6
Reviewed-on: https://skia-review.googlesource.com/96380
Commit-Queue: Hal Canary <halcanary@google.com>
Reviewed-by: Stephan Altmueller <stephana@google.com>

issue_comments.body: Unfortunately, the Reitveld tool we use to manage our repository clobbers both the author and committer fields of the commit (as well as adding its own commit message)
Skia does not accept pull requests.  [How to submit a patch](https://skia.org/dev/contrib/submit).

use safemath::mull for buffer sizes

Bug:780104
Change-Id: Ic683abd9c7d15ebb01b6e5d40dbeb6e76f102eff
Reviewed-on: https://skia-review.googlesource.com/95760
Reviewed-by: Brian Salomon <bsalomon@google.com>
Commit-Queue: Mike Reed <reed@google.com>

handle large rects, rename helper

To fix gm/bigrect, needed to do adjust "largest" rect so it doesn't become empty when round-tripping with SkRect/SkIRect.
I renamed it after this.

Reviewed-on: https://skia-review.googlesource.com/95564
Reviewed-by: Robert Phillips <robertphillips@google.com>
Commit-Queue: Brian Salomon <bsalomon@google.com>

Add Android ImageDecoder features to SkAnimatedImage

Bug: b/63909536
Bug: b/63908092

- Scale to an arbitrary size, using the decoding library if it supports
  it, and Skia otherwise
- Crop to a subset
- Post-processing with an SkPicture, to facilitate circle masks etc
- isRunning, to implement Animatable2 interface in Java

in the Debug-GPU configuration.

Update to GrBackendTexutreImageGenerator to support lazy texture proxies

Bug: skia:
Change-Id: I7cce869894e274250f49328550a0ae2d8e04de74
Reviewed-on: https://skia-review.googlesource.com/95022
Commit-Queue: Greg Daniel <egdaniel@google.com>
Reviewed-by: Brian Salomon <bsalomon@google.com>
Reviewed-by: Brian Osman <brianosman@google.com>
Reviewed-by: Robert Phillips <robertphillips@google.com>

Add ability for lazy proxy callback to free captured resources

This will be needed for DDLs that get recorded, but then deleted before
the proxies actually get instantiated.

Bug: skia:
Change-Id: I745366fc7a7edbcd43bc617220d3d4997baa8319
Reviewed-on: https://skia-review.googlesource.com/95101
Reviewed-by: Robert Phillips <robertphillips@google.com>
Commit-Queue: Greg Daniel <egdaniel@google.com>

Support scaled color emojis for SDF fallback

This patch enables scaling for overlarge color emojis when trying to
render with SDFs, i.e. between 162 and 324 point in normal text
rendering mode. Also ensures that we only try to render blobs with
bitmap/SDF when the text size will fit in the atlas.

Bug: skia:
Change-Id: Ib675d99ef22bf66368dc8737ef63db4a5d3d5a9f
Reviewed-on: https://skia-review.googlesource.com/94361
Reviewed-by: Brian Salomon <bsalomon@google.com>
Commit-Queue: Jim Van Verth <jvanverth@google.com>

Fix Viewer slide load on backend change - take 2

Split the slide switching logic (including load/unload) into
setCurrentSlide(), while keeping setupCurrentSlide() to deal with config
only.

Change-Id: I5bd2363ffd401c1b756217f845d4dbd16d6be5d6
Reviewed-on: https://skia-review.googlesource.com/94864

pull_requests.title: Fix github capitalization
pull_requests.body: You should already have my individual contributor agreement.

issue_comments.body:
I signed the CLA, but I haven't done the git cl upload part yet.

EDIT: First time using Gerrit, but [here's](https://skia-review.googlesource.com/c/6422/) the code review.

pull_requests.title: Fix typo "Skis"
pull_requests.body: Just a small typo i noticed when reading the website.

pull_requests.title: fixed linker error without SK_SUPPORT_GPU marco
[REFERENCE] Diff of Xamarin Changes
pull_requests.body:
This is just to show what Xamarin has added to skia, but not yet merged.

Typically, all our changes exist in the `include/c` and `src/c` folders. The other conflicts have to do with changes that haven't been merged from Google/skia/master yet.

issue_comments.body: No longer need the reference PR
Whoops, wrong merge :)

pull_requests.title: Update shell script to correct the syntax of functions
pull_requests.body: "sync-and-gyp" script fails on my Ubuntu shell. Fixing the syntax of functions in this script.

Thanks for your pull request.  It looks like this may be your first contribution to a Google open source project. Before we can look at your pull request, you'll need to sign a Contributor License Agreement (CLA).

:memo: **Please visit https://cla.developers.google.com/ to sign.**

Once you've signed, please reply here (e.g. `I signed it!`) and we'll verify.  Thanks.

---
- If you've already signed a CLA, it's possible we don't have your GitHub username or you're using a different email address.  Check [your existing CLA data](https://cla.developers.google.com/clas) and verify that your [email is set on your git commits](https://help.github.com/articles/setting-your-email-in-git/).
- If you signed the CLA as a corporation, please let us know the company's name.

<!-- ok -->
I signed it!

> Committed: https://skia.googlesource.com/skia/+/0be353487c0971475f9d19f2232d3642ea304b10
> @jcgregorio Any reason why the original author is not kept?

Well, _git commit --amend --author_ does the job too...
This is an unexpected way to recognize external contributions (especially as I signed the CLAs).
OK, thanks for taking the time to reply to my rant :)

No worries (as you can see with this second PR, I don't mind that much ;)
I was more surprised that your workflow cannot handle this case.

Thanks for the pull request, follow along on the progress of this change here:

  https://codereview.chromium.org/2234563003

Committed: https://skia.googlesource.com/skia/+/0be353487c0971475f9d19f2232d3642ea304b10

 Thanks again!

We don't directly accept pull requests, so I manually copied your contribution over to our normal submission process. If you are going to be submitting patches to Skia regularly then this is the process to follow:

  https://skia.org/dev/contrib/submit

Following that process will also keep the original author information intact on the git commit.
Thanks, can you submit this as a CL following https://skia.org/dev/contrib/submit ?

Following https://skia.org/dev/contrib/submit will make sure you get the credit in the commit. Just wanted to follow up given your public statement here: 

https://twitter.com/SylvestreLedru/status/767391472752689152
But our workflow, this one https://skia.org/dev/contrib/submit, can handle this case.

Landed here: https://skia.googlesource.com/skia/+/d0cd2ecf31bb49988bc8a7ff74ee05161c9538de

  Thanks!

Thanks for submitting the pull request! Could you follow the directions here on how to submit a patch to Skia: https://skia.org/dev/contrib/submit

Since you already have a working Skia checkout it should be as simple as running:

  git cl upload

Then add me (jcgregorio@google.com) as a reviewer on that CL and I will find the right people to actually do the review. Thanks!

commit_comments.body:
Is this API complete? Or there are other things that have to be added?

If not, are you planning to expose the entire Skia API as C?

Thanks
This seems to have caused a performance regression for Flutter: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/13731
